intro: Neomirandea ternata, commonly known as the slender mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of various host trees. It has small, oval-shaped leaves that are usually arranged in opposite pairs along its stems. The plant produces tiny, white or pale green flowers that bloom in the spring. Its berries are typically red or orange and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. Neomirandea ternata is native to parts of Europe and is often found in woodland areas with suitable host trees.
